pledge.title: Our Pledge: Exceptional Drones & Expertise
pledge.description: At Maviyom Aviation, we're elevating drone technology new heights with relentless innovation and unwavering quality. We design specialized solutions for diverse sectors, integrating an eco-friendly mindset with progressive development. Our commitment is to the customer, the community, and the global stage, ensuring adherence to strict regulatory standards. Join us at the forefront of drone innovation – where your vision takes flight.

CTASection.title: Navigate the Future with Maviyom Aviation

about_company.headline: Maviyom Aviation: Elevating Innovation
about_company.description: At Maviyom Aviation, we are committed to transcending the ordinary. Our aim is not merely to provide efficient and effective services but to do so with elegance and precision, ensuring an unparalleled experience for our clients.
about_company.footer_description: Maviyom Aviation is an emerging leader in the drone manufacturing sector, committed to innovating for the Indian skies and beyond. Our vision aligns with the government's aim to position India as a premier global drone hub by 2030. We craft drones tailored to meet the diverse needs of our customers, supporting applications across defence, surveying, and delivery. By offering high-quality drones at competitive prices, Maviyom is at the forefront of shaping the future of India's drone industry.

mission.title: Our Mission
mission.description: Maviyom is dedicated to researching, developing, and manufacturing high-performance drone systems that meet the rigorous demands of both defense and civilian sectors. Through continuous innovation, strategic partnerships, and a commitment to global standards, we aim to deliver reliable, scalable, and future-ready aerial solutions worldwide.

catalyzing-industrial-evolution.title: Catalyzing Industrial Evolution
catalyzing-industrial-evolution.description: User-centric drone solutions designed to enhance productivity, safety, and strategic growth.

architecting-tomorrows-tech.title: Architecting Tomorrow's Tech
architecting-tomorrows-tech.description: Pioneering advanced UAV solutions for a sustainable and secure future.

fostering-synergy-and-insight.title: Fostering Synergy and Insight
fostering-synergy-and-insight.description: Fusing creativity with collaboration to drive educational and technological breakthroughs in UAV development

driving-change-through-innovation.title: Driving Change Through Innovation
driving-change-through-innovation.description: Delivering UAV innovations for humanitarian efforts and complex problem-solving.

our_vision.title: Our Vision
our_vision.description: To engineer and deliver state-of-the-art unmanned systems for defence and civilian sectors worldwide, while continually expanding our manufacturing and R&D capabilities to meet the evolving needs that shape the future of security, logistics, and intelligence.

DesignEngineer.Description: We’re looking for a driven and hands-on Design Engineer to join our growing UAV startup. This role is ideal for someone with around 3+ years of experience in mechanical design and development—who’s ready to take full ownership of the mechanical and electromechanical aspects of UAV systems. As a core team member, you’ll work across product design, structural systems, payload integration, and mechanical-electronics packaging—contributing directly to the development of reliable, high-performance UAV platforms from the ground up.
Responsibilities: Design and develop UAV mechanical and electromechanical systems using modern CAD tools (e.g., SolidWorks, Fusion 360, AutoCAD).
Own the creation of detailed 2D/3D drawings, assemblies, and complete BOMs.
Perform simulations and design validation (FEA/CFD) to ensure structural and thermal performance.
Optimize designs for manufacturability, cost, assembly, and maintenance.
Work on payload mounts, airframes, motor mounts, and integration of propulsion and avionics systems.
Coordinate with electronics, flight systems, and manufacturing teams to ensure smooth integration and system-level reliability.
Assist in prototype builds, testing setups, and iterative design feedback loops.
Support flight testing, analyze performance data, and implement design improvements.
Work from first principles to create robust, scalable, and modular designs.
Evaluate and select materials and components suitable for lightweight, high-strength UAV applications (composites, polymers, aluminum, etc.).
Stay updated with new tools, materials, manufacturing techniques (CNC, 3D printing, injection molding, etc.).
Take full lifecycle ownership of designs—from concept through testing to production handover.
Qualifications: Bachelor’s or Master’s in Mechanical, Aerospace, or related engineering discipline.
3+ years of experience in product design and mechanical system development, preferably in aerospace, UAVs, or manufacturing.
Proficiency in CAD tools (SolidWorks, Fusion 360, etc.) and experience creating assemblies and detailed drawings.
Familiarity with FEA/CFD tools for structural/thermal validation.
Knowledge of mechanical-electrical integration (e.g., housings, cable routing, thermal management).
Understanding of manufacturing processes (3D printing, machining, molding, sheet metal, etc.).
Strong analytical skills and solid foundation in mechanical fundamentals and materials science.
BonusSkills: Experience designing UAV-specific components (airframes, mounts, enclosures, etc.).
Knowledge of GD&T, DFM/DFT principles, and aerospace-grade materials.
Exposure to flight testing and UAV performance analysis.
Experience working in a fast-paced R&D or hardware startup environment.
Familiarity with electronics packaging and wire harnessing.

ElectronicsEngineer.Description: We’re looking for a hands-on, cross-functional Electronics Engineer to join our core team and help develop the critical electronic systems powering our UAV platforms. If you're passionate about drones, embedded tech, and building real systems from scratch, this is your opportunity to own the electronics stack—from schematic to sky. In this high-impact role, you’ll be responsible for designing and implementing electronics hardware, embedded firmware, and wireless communication systems, while working closely with the mechanical, software, and flight systems teams.
Responsibilities: Design, simulate, and develop PCBs for UAV subsystems including power distribution, sensor interfaces, and signal conditioning.
Select and integrate MCUs, IMUs, GPS modules, telemetry systems, and other electronic components.
Perform schematic capture, layout, and bring-up of electronic assemblies.
Lead hardware debugging and system validation during both lab and flight testing.
Develop embedded firmware for microcontrollers (preferably ARM Cortex-M, STM32).
Integrate and optimize communication protocols (UART, SPI, I2C, CAN) and sensor drivers.
Design and optimize wireless communication systems (RF, Wi-Fi, Cellular, LoRa) for command, control, and telemetry.
Collaborate with the mechanical team to integrate electronics into compact and rugged UAV platforms.
Assist in wire harnessing, EMI/EMC considerations, and enclosure design inputs.
Support flight testing, gather performance data, and implement iterative improvements.
Qualifications: Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Electronics, Electrical, or Electronics & Communication Engineering.
Minimum 3 years of experience in electronics product development, preferably in UAV, robotics, or aerospace sectors.
Strong grasp of analog/digital circuit design, embedded systems, and PCB layout.
Proficient in C/C++, microcontroller programming, and basic embedded systems debugging.
Familiar with PCB tools like Altium Designer, Eagle, or KiCAD.
Solid understanding of power systems (battery management, DC-DC converters), signal integrity, and sensor integration.
Hands-on experience with oscilloscopes, logic analyzers, and lab tools.
BonusSkills: Experience with UAV flight controllers (PX4, ArduPilot) and telemetry hardware.
Knowledge of sensor fusion, IMU/GPS integration, or Kalman filtering.
Familiarity with RTOS, low-power firmware optimization, or fault-tolerant systems.
Exposure to scripting (e.g., Python) for automation, data logging, or hardware validation.
Understanding of aerospace or UAV compliance and regulatory standards.

FlightStackLead.Description: Lead the migration from ArduPilot to PX4 and build next-gen autopilot systems across multiple UAV platforms.
Responsibilities: Lead migration from ArduPilot to PX4 across multiple UAV platforms (quad, hex, VTOL, nano, cargo).
Integrate vSLAM (visual simultaneous localisation and mapping) + IMU fusion for GPS-denied navigation.
Design and maintain robust failsafe behaviours (auto-hold, return-to-home, swarm handoff).
Ensure code quality with MISRA-C compliance and hardware-in-the-loop regression testing.
Qualifications: 6+ years in embedded flight-control or aerospace autopilot development.
Strong expertise in PX4/NuttX RTOS and C/C++.
Demonstrated experience in control law modelling (MATLAB/Simulink).
Hands-on flight test and tuning experience.
BonusSkills: Familiarity with DGQA certification standards and defense-grade autopilot requirements.
Experience optimising for low-latency flight control loops.
Strong debugging skills with oscilloscopes, logic analysers, and HIL rigs.

EdgeAIArchitect.Description: Architect and optimise our 8-TOPS low-power edge AI module for UAV applications.
Responsibilities: Architect our 8-TOPS low-power edge AI module.
Develop and optimise vision models for object detection, recognition, and tracking.
Quantise, prune, and compress neural networks for ≤10 W power budget.
Build APIs for adaptive route re-planning, loitering and swarm logic.
Oversee OTA AI model update pipeline linked to Indore GPU cluster.
Qualifications: 5+ years in embedded deep learning or robotics AI.
Proficiency with PyTorch, TensorRT, ONNX, CUDA.
Experience deploying models on Nvidia Jetson, Qualcomm Robotics or similar.
Strong grasp of computer vision and real-time inference.
BonusSkills: Prior work with ISR imagery datasets.
Knowledge of adversarial robustness and AI security.
Strong collaboration with hardware teams for thermal/power optimisation.

SwarmECCMLead.Description: Design resilient, encrypted mesh networking and advanced ECCM protocols for UAV swarm operations.
Responsibilities: Design and deliver MESH-ADR communications layer for swarms.
Develop encrypted mesh networking with self-healing and sub-second task allocation.
Implement spectrum-hopping, ECCM and LPI/LPD waveforms.
Validate resilience through simulation, HIL testing, and outdoor swarm trials.
Qualifications: 7+ years in wireless communications, tactical radios, or UAV networking.
Deep knowledge of SDR, FHSS.
Proficiency in embedded firmware (C/C++).
Experience with secure communications and crypto protocols.
BonusSkills: Background in military-grade comms or defense R&D projects.
Familiarity with mesh routing protocols and swarm robotics.
Strong analytical skills for RF propagation and link-budget modelling.

GroundControlUXLead.Description: Lead development of next-gen GCS with advanced multi-drone operations and operator-first UX design.
Responsibilities: Design next-gen GCS for multi-airframe fleet operations.
Implement features: 3-D terrain, geofencing, multi-drone handoff.
Develop operator plug-ins for ISR analytics.
Ensure compliance with STANAG 4609 video export standards.
Lead UX testing with military and paramilitary operators.
Qualifications: 6+ years in GCS or mission-control software development.
Proficiency in Qt/QML, React, and GIS libraries.
Understanding of military interoperability standards (STANAG).
Strong background in user-centric interface design.
BonusSkills: Past experience with defense or aerospace mission systems.
Ability to balance minimal training burden with advanced functionality.
Exposure to speech/voice command integration.

DevOpsHPCLead.Description: Own DevOps pipelines, GPU cluster optimisation, and OTA release processes for UAV software systems.
Responsibilities: Build CI/CD pipelines for PX4, AI models, and swarm firmware.
Manage hardware-in-the-loop regression and fuzz testing.
Implement static analysis, SBOM scans, and compliance checks.
Optimise GPU cluster workloads for CFD and swarm training.
Oversee OTA release process and blue-green deployments.
Qualifications: 5+ years in DevOps, SRE, or robotics software infra.
Experience with GitLab CI, Kubernetes, Docker, and GPU cluster management.
Familiar with cybersecurity compliance (NIST, ISO 27001).
Strong background in scripting (Python, Bash).
BonusSkills: Prior experience in aerospace or robotics DevOps environments.
Knowledge of flight software toolchains (PX4 SITL, Gazebo).
Passion for automation, observability, and infrastructure as code.

Contact us today and let's navigate the future together.

TermsAndConditionsPage.title: Terms and Conditions
TermsAndConditionsPage.info: Welcome to Maviyom, a leading drone manufacturing and aviation company. By accessing and using our website, you agree to comply with the following Terms and Conditions:

content.text1: All content, materials, logos, and trademarks displayed on our website are the property of Maviyom or their respective owners. You must not reproduce, distribute, modify, or use any of our intellectual property without obtaining prior written consent.

You may use our website for personal, non-commercial purposes related to the exploration, purchase, or support of our drone products and services. Any unauthorized use or misuse of our website is strictly prohibited.

When operating our drones, you agree to comply with all applicable laws, regulations, and safety guidelines. This includes obtaining necessary licenses, respecting privacy, and adhering to airspace restrictions.
content.text2: It is your responsibility to operate our drones safely and responsibly.

content.text1: While we strive to provide accurate information, our website may contain errors or inaccuracies. We are not liable for any direct, indirect, incidental, or consequential damages arising from your use or reliance on the information provided on our website.
content.text2: Maviyom shall not be held responsible for any damages or losses incurred during the operation of our drones or as a result of their use.

content.text1: By using our website and services, you agree to indemnify and hold Maviyom, its affiliates, employees, and partners harmless from any claims, losses, damages, liabilities, and expenses (including legal fees) arising out of your use of our website, violation of these Terms and Conditions, or infringement of any third-party rights.

PrivacyPolicyPage.title: Privacy Policy
PrivacyPolicyPage.info: Maviyom, an innovative drone manufacturing and aviation company, prioritizes the privacy of your personal information. You can read this Privacy Policy to learn more about how we collect, utilize, and protect your personal information whenever you engage with our website and services. You agree to the terms of this Privacy Policy when you access or use our website.

content.text1: Personal Information: When you engage with our website or services, we may collect personal information such as your name, email address, phone number, and shipping address. We may also collect additional information necessary for specific services or transactions.
content.text2: Usage Information: We may gather non-personal information about your interactions with our website, including IP address, browser type, device information, and usage patterns. This information helps us analyze and improve our website and services.
content.text3: Cookies: To enhance your browsing experience, we may utilize cookies and similar technologies. These cookies may collect information about your preferences, sessions, and interactions with our website.

content.text1: Personal Information: We use your personal information to fulfill orders, provide customer support, communicate important updates, and send promotional materials related to our drone products and services.
content.text2: Usage Information: Non-personal information is used to analyze website usage patterns, monitor website performance, and make enhancements to provide you with a seamless experience.

content.text1: We employ industry-standard security measures to protect your personal information against unauthorized access, alteration, or disclosure. This includes encryption, firewalls, access controls, and regular security audits.
content.text2: However, please be aware that no data transmission over the internet or electronic storage method is completely secure. While we strive to protect your information, we cannot guarantee absolute security.

content.text1: Our website may contain links to third-party websites or services. Please note that we are not responsible for their content or privacy practices. We encourage you to review the privacy policies of these third parties before providing any personal information.

We reserve the right to modify or update this Privacy Policy at any time. Any changes will be effective immediately upon posting the revised policy on our website. By continuing to use our services after such changes, you accept and agree to the updated Privacy Policy.
